column.name: OBJECT_TYPE
column.Comment: Object type. One of BACKUP, COMMIT, EVENT, FUNCTION, GLOBAL, LOCKING SERVICE, PROCEDURE, SCHEMA, TABLE, TABLESPACE, TRIGGER (unused) or USER LEVEL LOCK.

column.name: OBJECT_SCHEMA
column.Comment: Object schema.

column.name: OBJECT_NAME
column.Comment: Object name.

column.name: OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN
column.Comment: Address in memory of the instrumented object.

column.name: LOCK_TYPE
column.Comment: Lock type. One of BACKUP_FTWRL1, BACKUP_START, BACKUP_TRANS_DML, EXCLUSIVE, INTENTION_EXCLUSIVE, SHARED, SHARED_HIGH_PRIO, SHARED_NO_READ_WRITE, SHARED_NO_WRITE, SHARED_READ, SHARED_UPGRADABLE or SHARED_WRITE.

column.name: LOCK_DURATION
column.Comment: Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).

column.name: LOCK_STATUS
column.Comment: Lock status. One of GRANTED, KILLED, PENDING, POST_RELEASE_NOTIFY, PRE_ACQUIRE_NOTIFY, TIMEOUT or VICTIM.

column.name: SOURCE
column.Comment: Source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event, as well as the line number where the instrumentation occurred. This allows one to examine the source code involved.

column.name: OWNER_THREAD_ID
column.Comment: Thread that requested the lock.

column.name: OWNER_EVENT_ID
column.Comment: Event that requested the lock.

column.name: NAME
column.Comment: Instrument name associated with the mutex.

column.name: OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN
column.Comment: Memory address of the instrumented mutex.

column.name: LOCKED_BY_THREAD_ID
column.Comment: The THREAD_ID of the locking thread if a thread has a mutex locked, otherwise NULL.

column.name: OBJECT_TYPE
column.Comment: Groups records together with OBJECT_SCHEMA and OBJECT_NAME.

column.name: OBJECT_SCHEMA
column.Comment: Groups records together with OBJECT_TYPE and OBJECT_NAME.

column.name: OBJECT_NAME
column.Comment: Groups records together with OBJECT_SCHEMA and OBJECT_TYPE.

column.name: COUNT_STAR
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: SUM_TIMER_WAIT
column.Comment: Total wait time of the summarized events that are timed.

column.name: MIN_TIMER_WAIT
column.Comment: Minimum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.

column.name: AVG_TIMER_WAIT
column.Comment: Average wait time of the summarized events that are timed.

column.name: MAX_TIMER_WAIT
column.Comment: Maximum wait time of the summarized events that are timed.

column.name: TIMER_NAME
column.Comment: Time name, used in the setup_timers table.

column.name: TIMER_FREQUENCY
column.Comment: Number of timer units per second. Dependent on the processor speed.

column.name: TIMER_RESOLUTION
column.Comment: Number of timer units by which timed values increase each time.

column.name: TIMER_OVERHEAD
column.Comment: Minimum timer overhead, determined during initialization by calling the timer 20 times and selecting the smallest value. Total overhead will be at least double this, as the timer is called at the beginning and end of each timed event.

column.name: OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN
column.Comment: The address in memory of the instrumented prepared statement.

column.name: STATEMENT_ID
column.Comment: The internal statement ID assigned by the server.

column.name: STATEMENT_NAME
column.Comment: For the binary protocol, this column is NULL. For the text protocol, this column is the external statement name assigned by the user.

column.name: SQL_TEXT
column.Comment: The prepared statement text, with ? placeholder markers.

column.name: OWNER_THREAD_ID
column.Comment: Event thread id that created the prepared statement.

column.name: OWNER_EVENT_ID
column.Comment: Event id that created the prepared statement.

column.name: OWNER_OBJECT_TYPE
column.Comment: NULL for a prepared statement created by a client session. Type of the stored program that created the prepared statement.

column.name: OWNER_OBJECT_SCHEMA
column.Comment: NULL for a prepared statement created by a client session. Schema of the stored program that created the prepared statement.

column.name: OWNER_OBJECT_NAME
column.Comment: NULL for a prepared statement created by a client session. Name of the stored program that created the prepared statement.

column.name: TIMER_PREPARE
column.Comment: The time spent executing the statement preparation itself.

column.name: COUNT_REPREPARE
column.Comment: The number of times the statement was reprepared internally.

column.name: COUNT_EXECUTE
column.Comment: Total times the prepared statement was executed.

column.name: SUM_TIMER_EXECUTE
column.Comment: Total time spent executing all prepared statements.

column.name: MIN_TIMER_EXECUTE
column.Comment: Minimum time spent executing any of the prepared statements.

column.name: AVG_TIMER_EXECUTE
column.Comment: Average time spent executing any of the prepared statements.

column.name: MAX_TIMER_EXECUTE
column.Comment: Maximum time spent executing any of the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_LOCK_TIME
column.Comment: The total time spent (in picoseconds) waiting for table locks for the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_ERRORS
column.Comment: The total number of errors that occurend for the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_WARNINGS
column.Comment: The total number of warnings that occurend for the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_ROWS_AFFECTED
column.Comment: The total number of affected rows by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_ROWS_SENT
column.Comment: The total number of rows returned by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_ROWS_EXAMINED
column.Comment: The total number of rows examined by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_CREATED_TMP_DISK_TABLES
column.Comment: The total number of on-disk temporary tables created by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_CREATED_TMP_TABLES
column.Comment: The total number of in-memory temporary tables created by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SELECT_FULL_JOIN
column.Comment: The total number of full joins executed by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SELECT_FULL_RANGE_JOIN
column.Comment: The total number of range search joins executed by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SELECT_RANGE
column.Comment: The total number of joins that used ranges on the first table executed by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SELECT_RANGE_CHECK
column.Comment: The total number of joins that check for key usage after each row executed by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SELECT_SCAN
column.Comment: The total number of joins that did a full scan of the first table executed by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SORT_MERGE_PASSES
column.Comment: The total number of merge passes that the sort algorithm has had to do for the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SORT_RANGE
column.Comment: The total number of sorts that were done using ranges for the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SORT_ROWS
column.Comment: The total number of sorted rows that were sorted by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_SORT_SCAN
column.Comment: The total number of sorts that were done by scanning the table by the prepared statements.

column.name: SUM_NO_INDEX_USED
column.Comment: The total number of statements that performed a table scan without using an index.

column.name: SUM_NO_GOOD_INDEX_USED
column.Comment: The total number of statements where no good index was found.

column.name: CHANNEL_NAME
column.Comment: Replication channel name.

column.name: DESIRED_DELAY
column.Comment: Target number of seconds the replica should be delayed to the master.

column.name: CHANNEL_NAME
column.Comment: The replication channel name.

column.name: SERVICE_STATE
column.Comment: Shows ON when the replication channel's applier threads are active or idle, OFF means that the applier threads are not active.

column.name: REMAINING_DELAY
column.Comment: Seconds the replica needs to wait to reach the desired delay from master.

column.name: COUNT_TRANSACTIONS_RETRIES
column.Comment: The number of retries that were made because the replication SQL thread failed to apply a transaction.

column.name: CHANNEL_NAME
column.Comment: Replication channel name.

column.name: THREAD_ID
column.Comment: The SQL/coordinator thread ID.

column.name: SERVICE_STATE
column.Comment: ON (thread exists and is active or idle) or OFF (thread no longer exists).

column.name: LAST_ERROR_NUMBER
column.Comment: Last error number that caused the SQL/coordinator thread to stop.

column.name: LAST_ERROR_MESSAGE
column.Comment: Last error message that caused the SQL/coordinator thread to stop.

column.name: LAST_ERROR_TIMESTAMP
column.Comment: Timestamp that shows when the most recent SQL/coordinator error occurred.

column.name: LAST_SEEN_TRANSACTION
column.Comment: The transaction the worker has last seen.

column.name: LAST_TRANS_RETRY_COUNT
column.Comment: Total number of retries attempted by last transaction.

column.name: CHANNEL_NAME
column.Comment: Name of replication channel through which the transaction is received.

column.name: THREAD_ID
column.Comment: Thread_Id as displayed in the performance_schema.threads table for thread with name 'thread/sql/rpl_parallel_thread'. THREAD_ID will be NULL when worker threads are stopped due to error/force stop.

column.name: SERVICE_STATE
column.Comment: Whether or not the thread is running.

column.name: LAST_SEEN_TRANSACTION
column.Comment: Last GTID executed by worker

column.name: LAST_ERROR_NUMBER
column.Comment: Last Error that occurred on a particular worker.

column.name: LAST_ERROR_MESSAGE
column.Comment: Last error specific message.

column.name: LAST_ERROR_TIMESTAMP
column.Comment: Time stamp of last error.

column.name: WORKER_IDLE_TIME
column.Comment: Total idle time in seconds that the worker thread has spent waiting for work from SQL thread.

column.name: LAST_TRANS_RETRY_COUNT
column.Comment: Total number of retries attempted by last transaction.

column.name: CHANNEL_NAME
column.Comment: The replication channel used.

column.name: HOST
column.Comment: The host name of the source that the replica is connected to.

column.name: PORT
column.Comment: The port used to connect to the source.

column.name: USER
column.Comment: The user name of the replication user account used to connect to the source.

column.name: USING_GTID
column.Comment: Whether replication is using GTIDs or not

column.name: SSL_ALLOWED
column.Comment: Whether SSL is allowed for the replica connection.

column.name: SSL_CA_FILE
column.Comment: Path to the file that contains one or more certificates for trusted Certificate Authorities (CA) to use for TLS.

column.name: SSL_CA_PATH
column.Comment: Path to a directory that contains one or more PEM files that contain X509 certificates for a trusted Certificate Authority (CA) to use for TLS.

column.name: SSL_CERTIFICATE
column.Comment: Path to the certificate used to authenticate the master.

column.name: SSL_CIPHER
column.Comment: Which cipher is used for encription.

column.name: SSL_KEY
column.Comment: Path to the private key used for TLS.

column.name: SSL_VERIFY_SERVER_CERTIFICATE
column.Comment: Whether the server certificate is verified as part of the SSL connection

column.name: SSL_CRL_FILE
column.Comment: Path to the PEM file containing one or more revoked X.509 certificates.

column.name: SSL_CRL_PATH
column.Comment: PATH to a folder containing PEM files containing one or more revoked X.509 certificates.

column.name: CONNECTION_RETRY_INTERVAL
column.Comment: The number of seconds between connect retries.

column.name: CONNECTION_RETRY_COUNT
column.Comment: The number of times the replica can attempt to reconnect to the source in the event of a lost connection.

column.name: HEARTBEAT_INTERVAL
column.Comment: Number of seconds after which a heartbeat will be sent.

column.name: IGNORE_SERVER_IDS
column.Comment: Binary log events from servers (ids) to ignore.

column.name: REPL_DO_DOMAIN_IDS
column.Comment: Only apply binary logs from these domain ids.

column.name: REPL_IGNORE_DOMAIN_IDS
column.Comment: Binary log events from domains to ignore.

column.name: NAME
column.Comment: Instrument name associated with the read write lock

column.name: OBJECT_INSTANCE_BEGIN
column.Comment: Address in memory of the instrumented lock

column.Comment: THREAD_ID of the locking thread if locked in write (exclusive) mode, otherwise NULL.

column.name: ATTR_NAME

column.name: ORDINAL_POSITION
column.Comment: Order in which attribute was added to the connection attributes.

column.name: ENABLED
column.Comment: Whether or not the instrument is enabled. It can be disabled, and the instrument will produce no events.

column.name: TIMED
column.Comment: Whether or not the instrument is timed. It can be set, but if disabled, events produced by the instrument will have NULL values for the corresponding TIMER_START, TIMER_END, and TIMER_WAIT values.

column.Comment: Type of object to instrument.

column.name: THREAD_ID
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.name: NAME
column.Comment: Name associated with the server's thread instrumentation code, for example thread/sql/main for the server's main() function, and thread/sql/one_connection for a user connection.

column.name: TYPE
column.Comment: FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND, depending on the thread type. User connection threads are FOREGROUND, internal server threads are BACKGROUND.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_ID
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_USER
column.Comment: Foreground thread user, or NULL for a background thread.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_HOST
column.Comment: Foreground thread host, or NULL for a background thread.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_DB
column.Comment: Thread's default database, or NULL if none exists.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_COMMAND
column.Comment: Type of command executed by the thread. These correspond to the the COM_xxx client/server protocol commands, and the Com_xxx status variables. See Thread Command Values.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_TIME
column.Comment: Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_STATE
column.Comment: Action, event or state indicating what the thread is doing.

column.name: PROCESSLIST_INFO
column.Comment: Statement being executed by the thread, or NULL if a statement is not being executed. If a statement results in calling other statements, such as for a stored procedure, the innermost statement from the stored procedure is shown here.

column.name: PARENT_THREAD_ID
column.Comment: THREAD_ID of the parent thread, if any. Subthreads can for example be spawned as a result of INSERT DELAYED statements.

column.name: ROLE
column.Comment: Unused.

column.name: INSTRUMENTED
column.Comment: YES or NO for Whether the thread is instrumented or not. For foreground threads, the initial value is determined by whether there's a user/host match in the setup_actors table. Subthreads are again matched, while for background threads, this will be set to YES by default. To monitor events that the thread executes, INSTRUMENTED must be YES and the thread_instrumentation consumer in the setup_consumers table must also be YES.

column.name: HISTORY
column.Comment: Whether to log historical events for the thread.

column.name: CONNECTION_TYPE
column.Comment: The protocol used to establish the connection, or NULL for background threads.

column.name: THREAD_OS_ID
column.Comment: The thread or task identifier as defined by the underlying operating system, if there is one.

column.name: THREAD_ID
column.Comment: The thread identifier of the session in which the variable is defined.

column.name: VARIABLE_NAME
column.Comment: The variable name, without the leading @ character.

column.name: VARIABLE_VALUE
column.Comment: The variable value

column.name: USER
column.Comment: The connection's client user name for the connection, or NULL if an internal thread.

column.name: CURRENT_CONNECTIONS
column.Comment: Current connections for the user.

column.name: TOTAL_CONNECTIONS
column.Comment: Total connections for the user.

column.name: event_name
column.Comment: Event name. Used together with USER and HOST for grouping events.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: event_name
column.Comment: Event name. Used together with HOST for grouping events.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events, which includes all timed and untimed events.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: rows_sent
column.Comment: Sum of the ROWS_SENT column in the events_statements_current table.

column.name: rows_examined
column.Comment: Sum of the ROWS_EXAMINED column in the events_statements_current table.

column.name: rows_affected
column.Comment: Sum of the ROWS_AFFECTED column in the events_statements_current table.

column.name: thread_id
column.Comment: Thread associated with the event. Together with EVENT_NAME uniquely identifies the row.

column.name: processlist_id
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: count_read
column.Comment: Number of all read operations, including FGETS, FGETC, FREAD, and READ.

column.name: count_write
column.Comment: Number of all write operations, including FPUTS, FPUTC, FPRINTF, VFPRINTF, FWRITE, and PWRITE.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: count_read
column.Comment: Number of all read operations, including FGETS, FGETC, FREAD, and READ.

column.name: count_write
column.Comment: Number of all write operations, including FPUTS, FPUTC, FPRINTF, VFPRINTF, FWRITE, and PWRITE.

column.name: count_misc
column.Comment: Number of all miscellaneous operations not counted above, including CREATE, DELETE, OPEN, CLOSE, STREAM_OPEN, STREAM_CLOSE, SEEK, TELL, FLUSH, STAT, FSTAT, CHSIZE, RENAME, and SYNC.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: count_read
column.Comment: Number of all read operations, including FGETS, FGETC, FREAD, and READ.

column.name: count_write
column.Comment: Number of all write operations, including FPUTS, FPUTC, FPRINTF, VFPRINTF, FWRITE, and PWRITE.

column.name: total
column.Comment: Number of summarized events

column.name: count_read
column.Comment: Number of all read operations, including FGETS, FGETC, FREAD, and READ.

column.name: count_write
column.Comment: Number of all write operations, including FPUTS, FPUTC, FPRINTF, VFPRINTF, FWRITE, and PWRITE.

column.name: operation
column.Comment: Operation type, for example read, write or lock

column.name: thread_id
column.Comment: Thread id.

column.name: event_name
column.Comment: Event name.

column.name: current_count
column.Comment: Currently allocated blocks that have not been freed (COUNT_ALLOC minus COUNT_FREE).

column.name: high_count
column.Comment: Highest number of allocated blocks (highest value of CURRENT_COUNT_USED).

column.name: thd_id
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.name: conn_id
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: db
column.Comment: Thread's default database, or NULL if none exists.

column.name: command
column.Comment: Type of command executed by the thread. These correspond to the the COM_xxx client/server protocol commands, and the Com_xxx status variables. See Thread Command Values.

column.name: state
column.Comment: Action, event or state indicating what the thread is doing.

column.name: time
column.Comment: Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.

column.name: rows_examined
column.Comment: Number of rows read during the statement's execution.

column.name: rows_sent
column.Comment: Number of rows returned.

column.name: rows_affected
column.Comment: Number of rows affected the statement affected.

column.name: tmp_tables
column.Comment: Number of temp tables created by the statement.

column.name: tmp_disk_tables
column.Comment: Number of on-disk temp tables created by the statement.

column.name: last_wait
column.Comment: Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table

column.name: source
column.Comment: Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.

column.name: trx_state
column.Comment: The current transaction state. The value is ACTIVE (after START TRANSACTION or BEGIN), COMMITTED (after COMMIT), or ROLLED BACK (after ROLLBACK).

column.name: trx_autocommit
column.Comment: Whether autcommit mode was enabled when the transaction started.

column.name: pid
column.Comment: Attribute value.

column.name: program_name
column.Comment: Attribute value.

column.name: variable_name
column.Comment: The global status variable name.

column.name: variable_value
column.Comment: The global status variable value.

column.name: table_schema
column.Comment: Schema name.

column.name: table_name
column.Comment: Table name.

column.name: index_name
column.Comment: Index name, or PRIMARY for the primary index, NULL for no index (inserts are counted in this case).

column.name: rows_selected
column.Comment: Number of all fetch operations.

column.name: rows_inserted
column.Comment: Number of all insert operations.

column.name: rows_updated
column.Comment: Number of all update operations.

column.name: rows_deleted
column.Comment: Number of all delete operations.

column.name: object_schema
column.Comment: Object schema.

column.name: object_name
column.Comment: Object name.

column.name: waiting_thread_id
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.name: waiting_pid
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: waiting_lock_type
column.Comment: Lock type. One of BACKUP_FTWRL1, BACKUP_START, BACKUP_TRANS_DML, EXCLUSIVE, INTENTION_EXCLUSIVE, SHARED, SHARED_HIGH_PRIO, SHARED_NO_READ_WRITE, SHARED_NO_WRITE, SHARED_READ, SHARED_UPGRADABLE or SHARED_WRITE.

column.name: waiting_lock_duration
column.Comment: Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).

column.name: waiting_query_secs
column.Comment: Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.

column.name: waiting_query_rows_affected
column.Comment: Number of rows affected the statement affected.

column.name: waiting_query_rows_examined
column.Comment: Number of rows read during the statement's execution.

column.name: blocking_thread_id
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.name: blocking_pid
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: blocking_lock_type
column.Comment: Lock type. One of BACKUP_FTWRL1, BACKUP_START, BACKUP_TRANS_DML, EXCLUSIVE, INTENTION_EXCLUSIVE, SHARED, SHARED_HIGH_PRIO, SHARED_NO_READ_WRITE, SHARED_NO_WRITE, SHARED_READ, SHARED_UPGRADABLE or SHARED_WRITE.

column.name: blocking_lock_duration
column.Comment: Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).

column.Comment: Value in picoseconds of the event's duration or NULL if the event has not ended or timing is not collected.

column.Comment: Operation type, for example read, write or lock

column.name: requested
column.Comment: Number of bytes that the operation read or wrote, or NULL for table I/O waits.

column.Comment: Current number of bytes used (total allocated minus total freed).

column.name: thread_id
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.Comment: Current number of bytes used (total allocated minus total freed).

column.Comment: Current number of bytes used (total allocated minus total freed).

column.Comment: Event name.

column.name: current_count
column.Comment: Currently allocated blocks that have not been freed (COUNT_ALLOC minus COUNT_FREE).

column.name: current_alloc
column.Comment: Current number of bytes used (total allocated minus total freed).

column.name: high_count
column.Comment: Highest number of allocated blocks (highest value of CURRENT_COUNT_USED).

column.Comment: Highest number of bytes used.

column.name: thd_id
column.Comment: A unique thread identifier.

column.name: conn_id
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: db
column.Comment: Thread's default database, or NULL if none exists.

column.name: command
column.Comment: Type of command executed by the thread. These correspond to the the COM_xxx client/server protocol commands, and the Com_xxx status variables. See Thread Command Values.

column.name: state
column.Comment: Action, event or state indicating what the thread is doing.

column.name: time
column.Comment: Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.

column.name: current_statement
column.Comment: Statement being executed by the thread, or NULL if a statement is not being executed. If a statement results in calling other statements, such as for a stored procedure, the innermost statement from the stored procedure is shown here.

column.name: lock_latency
column.Comment: Time in picoseconds spent waiting for locks. The time is calculated in microseconds but stored in picoseconds for compatibility with other timings.

column.name: rows_examined
column.Comment: Number of rows read during the statement's execution.

column.name: rows_sent
column.Comment: Number of rows returned.

column.name: rows_affected
column.Comment: Number of rows affected the statement affected.

column.name: tmp_tables
column.Comment: Number of temp tables created by the statement.

column.name: tmp_disk_tables
column.Comment: Number of on-disk temp tables created by the statement.

column.name: last_wait
column.Comment: Event instrument name and a NAME from the setup_instruments table

column.name: source
column.Comment: Name and line number of the source file containing the instrumented code that produced the event.

column.name: trx_latency
column.Comment: The unit is picoseconds. Event duration. NULL if event has not timing information.

column.name: trx_state
column.Comment: The current transaction state. The value is ACTIVE (after START TRANSACTION or BEGIN), COMMITTED (after COMMIT), or ROLLED BACK (after ROLLBACK).

column.name: trx_autocommit
column.Comment: Whether autcommit mode was enabled when the transaction started.

column.Comment: Attribute value.

column.name: waiting_pid
column.Comment: The PROCESSLIST.ID value for threads displayed in the INFORMATION_SCHEMA.PROCESSLIST table, or 0 for background threads. Also corresponds with the CONNECTION_ID() return value for the thread.

column.name: waiting_lock_type
column.Comment: Lock type. One of BACKUP_FTWRL1, BACKUP_START, BACKUP_TRANS_DML, EXCLUSIVE, INTENTION_EXCLUSIVE, SHARED, SHARED_HIGH_PRIO, SHARED_NO_READ_WRITE, SHARED_NO_WRITE, SHARED_READ, SHARED_UPGRADABLE or SHARED_WRITE.

column.name: waiting_lock_duration
column.Comment: Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).

column.name: waiting_query
column.Comment: Statement being executed by the thread, or NULL if a statement is not being executed. If a statement results in calling other statements, such as for a stored procedure, the innermost statement from the stored procedure is shown here.

column.name: waiting_query_secs
column.Comment: Time in seconds the thread has been in its current state.

column.name: waiting_query_rows_affected
column.Comment: Number of rows affected the statement affected.

column.name: waiting_query_rows_examined
column.Comment: Number of rows read during the statement's execution.

column.name: blocking_lock_type

column.name: blocking_lock_duration
column.Comment: Lock duration. One of EXPLICIT (locks released by explicit action, for example a global lock acquired with FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK) , STATEMENT (locks implicitly released at statement end) or TRANSACTION (locks implicitly released at transaction end).
